newsitem.title: USA: US Rep. Leach opposes longer check clearing rules.
newsitem.headline: US Rep. Leach opposes longer check clearing rules.

text.p: House Banking Committee chairman Jim Leach said he is opposed to a Federal Reserve proposal giving banks an additional day to clear checks.

"While in most matters I generally defer to the professionalism of the Federal Reserve Board and its staff, in this instance many of us believe that the Federal Reserve's recommendation should not be enacted," the Iowa Republican said in a letter to Fed chairman Alan Greenspan.
The proposal to give banks three days to clear local checks, up from two allowed now, was contained in a package of legislative requests the Fed sent to Congress last year.
Congress is unlikely to act on the proposal, which would amend the Expedited Funds Availability Act, Leach said.
